name: John Ian So
details:
My name is John and I'm a junior mentor for CS 61A. I took this class last semester as a freshman and had a great time! This class is definitely challenging at times, and I want to be there to help you find success. I've worked with Python before CS 61A; Python was the first language I learned in high school. Since then, I've also worked a lot with Java, and a little bit with C. 

Some facts about me:
I love really nice socks. I have a collection of about 20 just here in Berkeley. My favorite pair of socks are a pair of lime green ones with Kermit the Frog on them.
I'm a huge robotics nerd. I competed in VRC throughout high school and unofficially mentor a team when I have time. In the future, I want to work within robotics and control systems.
I'm beginning to get into rock climbing! I definitely prefer bouldering over top roping.
I love boba despite my lactose intolerance. My favorite boba shop in Berkeley has to be Yi Fang, but my favorite boba shop in the Bay Area is Boba Bliss (Dublin represent!).
In my free time, you can probably find me out exploring Oakland and San Francisco.

I'm looking forward to a productive and exciting semester!

name: Andrew Busby
details: I’m a Third year EECS major from Southern California focusing on renewable power generation. When I took CS61C, I was astounded by how powerful I felt the material was for understanding/operating computers, so last term I served as an academic intern for the class on what has become a personal quest to one day be a TA and spread the excitement and understanding I’ve felt for the material to incoming students. I enjoy puzzles, collecting/reading books ([particularly very fancy ones] recently those have included: a lot of manga from the anime I watch, Eight Will Fall, The Merciful Crow, King of Scars [from the author of the Six of Crows series, which is frankly gold], The Lord of the Rings [finally finished! ^<^], the bible [for historical/cultural purposes], After the Fall, The Dome in the Forest [part of the Pelbar Cycle, also gold, though slower paced], Pride and Prejudice [further gold], and the complete works of Edgar Allan Poe), video games ([especially puzzle/adventure games] Minecraft, Portal, Legend of Zelda, Sly Cooper, Crash Bandicoot, Kingdom Hearts, Smash Brothers, Pokémon, Undertale, Super Mario), listening to music [a lot of which is also from the anime I watch, aside from the nightcore and 2 Steps from Hell Orchestral music], seeing plays/musicals, spending time with family, interacting with young children, traveling, learning about/observing animals, cooking, playing board games, cultivating non-ornamental plants and learning about plant families, drawing (whether purely creatively or referencing any of the media I consume), discussing/coming up with fair and balanced policies, trivia/learning new information in general, trying to look edgy, watching select shows that appear on television (Jeopardy, Gotham, Gravity Falls, Star vs the Forces of Evil, Over the Garden Wall, Scooby Doo, Code Lyoko), watching anime (Mekakucity Actors, YuGiOh!, RWBY, My Hero Academia, Land of the Lustrous), learning Japanese/about Japanese culture, making/planning costumes and dressing up/cosplaying, preparing for and celebrating Halloween, and—most recently—attending conventions for nerds like me. Whew! I think that covers what I like to do. I admire the late Monty Oum as a person for his drive and dedication to creating something to be proud of. I’d say Leigh Bardugo is my favorite author, though I greatly respect Lemony Snicket, Trenton Lee Stewart, Stephenie Meyer, J.K. Rowling, Suzanne Collins, Jane Austen, and Jeanne DuPrau for the characters they made, the worlds they built, and the styles they presented. My favorite overall artist would have to be Jin for the depth he put into his songs and the story that they tell. I’m a vegetarian, so my favorite restaurant in Berkeley is The Butcher’s Son ([despite whatever my brother would have you believe about French restaurants in Berkeley] though it’s a bit pricey). This term I have decided that I’ve been doing college wrong the past 5 terms and have embarked on a journey to discover and become a part of fun clubs on campus. In the present, I plan to join the Berkeley Quizbowl club to satisfy my trivia needs, Cal Animage Alpha so I can finally discuss all the anime that I squee to myself about all week long with others and maybe squee together with them, Amigos at Berkeley so I can practice my Spanish before my family comes to visit this summer, Board Games at Berkeley so I can relax and find an acceptable space to let my cutthroat strategizing Slytherin side come out (or maybe play some co-op games ^^”), potentially the Berkeley Philosophy Forum so I can discuss my ideas with other humans and get some constructive criticism that I just can’t generate for myself like others do, potentially also the Pokémon Club on campus when they have movie nights since Pokémon movies are gold and 50 times better than the anime, and maybe also Smash at Berkeley for when they have Smash Bros tournaments [even though I know my wonderful Lucina with all of her counters, and Sheik with all of her scorpion kicks are simply not pro material, at least with me controlling them :-( ]. Hoof! Alright. I think that’s everything. *blink* Well, I imagine I’ve blathered far longer than you bargained for when you sat down and decided to read this. My bad ^^”
